visualization_prompt: Generate a polar area chart showing seasonal activity data with synthetic monthly values, null gaps, and non-stacked areas using Highcharts' polar coordinate system.

title.text: Polar Area Chart: Unconnected Null Values with Non-Stacked Series

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations with two intentional null values (April and November), creating data gaps. Synthetic values follow a seasonal pattern (μ=60, σ=18) with summer peak and winter decline, simulating real-world phenomena like tourism activity. The polar coordinate system emphasizes cyclical patterns while missing data gaps preserve truthfulness. The semi-transparent blue (#3F51B5) area encoding respects Cairo's perceptual principles for continuous data, while disabling stacking and null connections adheres to Tufte's data-ink maximization. Angular axis labels use month abbreviations for immediate recognition, and radial gridlines provide quantitative reference without visual clutter.
